title: Expert tips on bougainvillea, lily beetle control and late summer roses, from Helen Yemm
text:
A DISAPPOINTINGLY LEAFY HYDRANGEA

We have a hydrangea that, in its first year, was covered in flowers. Last year it had no flowers at all and this year produced just one. I prune it in the autumn, taking it back to about half its full size. Am I over-pruning, does it need feeding, or is there another solution?

Geoff Peasland – via email

Your picture showed an enormous Hydrangea aspera, trying to fit into much more than its allotted space, squeezing out hefty clumps of perennials. This hydrangea wants to be a whopper, whatever you do to it. It needs more space in which to thrive, and your pruning regime is the problem.
